column1: peter-van-der-hout-60336532,Peter,van der Hout,Over 30 years of supporting Sustainable Forest Management worldwide,https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E03AQFp8dPgksyYnA/profile-displayphoto-shrink_800_800/0/1668613849044?e=1697673600&v=beta&t=l3VBYQlsZc5Vl1zk6CUfERXZixROSmCbaOHOCWN_gjM,https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C5616AQG62xxvrCdufA/profile-displaybackgroundimage-shrink_350_1400/0/1516501682384?e=1697673600&v=beta&t=Az1u10T6syXD7c9JRoSs_UBznkR5HcWVYX3G0baeqng,personal,ACoAAAbQzyMBP_XqyNhlBpOtqh0p1_AMBV80ubQ,114347811,,"Forest Law Enforcement, Governance and Trade:

column2: Independent Forest Monitoring of forest law enforcement system in Guyana (2011-2014);
Evaluation of Guyana's Timber Legality Assurance System and EU-FLEGT VPA Annexes (2017);
Expert Panel Member Guyana FAO-EU FLEGT Programme (2017-2019);
Revision of the Belize Forest Act and Subsidiary legislation (2018-2019);

column1: -       Develop curricula and training manuals for relevant training institutions and VPA agencies in Guyana followed by a Training of Trainers programme in the use of the training manuals

column2: 25 FSC Forest Management audits in association with Soil Association Certification and SATIVA, Controlo e Certificação since 2012; in 10 countries worldwide, i.e., Australia, Croatia, Guyana, Portugal, Romania, Slovenia, Turkey, Uganda, United Kingdom and Vietnam.
Identifying strategies and training needs to achieve sustainable forest management (Suriname, 2006);
Codes of Practice for timber harvesting for Belize (2007), Guyana (2002 and 2014) and Suriname (2011);
Review of national SFM certification standard Vietnam (2013);
Update the Forestry Master Plan for Bangladesh (2016).

Experience in training trainers, forest department staff, forest managers, and forest workers in reduced impact logging, forest inventory methods and implementation of timber harvesting protocols in Belize (2007), Cameroon (2010), DRC (2012), Gabon (2005), Guyana (2002-2004), Suriname (2003, 2006, 2008) and Trinidad (2001).
Design and Implement REDD+ Pilot Activities for Guyana (2019)

column1: Forest inventory and forest management planning:

column2: Forest inventory and forest management plans for two long-term forest license areas in Belize (2017-19);
Forest management and annual operating plan for concessionaire in Suriname (2008).

column1: Studies in the field of Sustainable Forest Management:

column2: Evaluation of the current framework for Sustainable Forest Management in Guyana (2015-2016);
Resource assessment of the CITES-listed species Cedrela odorata in Guyana (2014-2015).

Countries: Australia, Bangladesh, Belize, Cameroon, Congo-Brazzaville, Congo-Kinshasa, Croatia, France, Gabon, Guyana, Netherlands, Portugal, Romania, Slovenia, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, Turkey, Uganda, United Kingdom, Vietnam', 'title': 'Forestry Consultant - Owner', 'employment_type': 'Self-employed'}]}, {'company': {'id': 424491, 'name': 'Forest Stewardship Council™', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQEsfkyqasfIlQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1664868591684?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=BnchcM_Y_TJTKOfVnL3avLyi51IO0Pnab58pe4cYGjY', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/fsc-international-bonn/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Home-office', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Forest Stewardship Council', 'description': 'Conduct a study on the economics of remediation in the context of forest conversion.

FSC restricted the conversion of natural forests to plantations and non-forest use in its Principles and Criteria since its establishment in 1994. Plantations established on lands converted after 1994 are not eligible for FSC Forest Management certification if the forest manager was directly or indirectly involved in the conversion.

In the last few decades, growing demand for natural resources resulted in increased pressure to convert much of the remaining forest ecosystems to other land uses. Simultaneously, there has been increased awareness for the need to promote restoration of degraded ecosystems as a means to fight climate change, land degradation and to avoid the loss of biological diversity.

Form International & Van der Hout Forestry Consulting conducted a conceptual assessment of the costs associated with the remedy scenarios proposed by FSC, to understand the magnitude of remediation cost scenarios in the context of land-use changes. Subsequently, a cost-benefit analysis was carried out to show under which circumstances an “investment into remediation” would be economically attractive.', 'title': 'Forestry Specialist', 'employment_type': 'Contract'}]}, {'company': {'id': 163765, 'name': 'FAO', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQGkEw1cImNSTQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1539165866324?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=ybNUe1PH5-8lftGdCyp169yRTYUqpWpGGU1r79VXzBk', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/fao/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Home-office', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'FAO', 'description': ""Within the framework of the FAO EU FLEGT Programme for Guyana curricula and training manuals were developed for relevant training institutions and VPA agencies in Guyana to deliver capacity-building programmes to Forest Sector organisations (FSOs) in order for those to comply with the GTLAS. This was followed by a Training of Trainers programme in the use of the training manuals.

Project outcomes:
1. Training institutes and relevant VPA agencies that will be providing capacity-building programmes for the successful implementation of the Guyana Timber Legality Assurance System (GTLAS) have been identified
2. Institutional capacities of training institutions and relevant VPA agencies that provide capacity-building programmes under the VPA have been assessed. 
3. Course curricula and training manuals for relevant VPA and training institutions involved in the implementation of the GTLAS have been developed
4. Training-of-Trainers' workshops with representatives of the training institutions and relevant VPA agencies in the curricula and use of the training manuals have been completed."", 'title': 'Forestry Consultant', 'employment_type': 'Contract'}]}, {'company': {'id': 1673408, 'name': 'AFC Agriculture and Finance Consultants', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEy9r2H835wQA/company-logo_400_400/0/1673619120884?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=48tLo5H6jJHKGTk2Pxg5OHNCoqfyzsC2JEePRSCOd-A', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/afc-agriculture-finance-consultants/', 'employees': {'start': 501, 'end': 1000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Rabat, Morocco', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'AFC Agriculture and Finance Consultants', 'description': 'The Morocco-German Technical Dialogue on Agriculture and Forestry (DIAF) project aims to promote dialogue and exchange of expertise on technology in the agricultural and forestry sectors. DIAF focuses on three components: 1. Organic farming, 2. Inter-Agricultural and Forestry Cooperation & 3. Forest planning and control.

Component 3 of the DIAF project addresses forest management planning and control and is supported by the achievement of four outputs:
1. Extension of the wood tracking system to all cedar forests in Morocco to control the wood trade and reduce illegal logging ;
2. Introduction of forest inventory and planning procedures to determine sustainable cedar harvest levels;
3. Introduction of thinning and timber harvesting procedures to promote quality and growth of cedar stands
4. Development and promotion of a regional value-added concept for cedar wood

Tasks:
- General project management, including planning, coordination and monitoring of the implementation of the component.
- Support to MAPMDREF for the scaling up of the wood tracking system at the national level.
- Advise relevant authorities on the development of appropriate forest inventory procedures as a basis for cedar forest management planning.
- Advise the competent authorities on the testing of thinning methods to improve the quality and value of cedar forests.
- Identify the need for short-term missions, plan and manage the missions and support national and international short-term experts.
- Assess training needs and develop and implement continuous training measures for civil servants and forest workers.
- Organise study tours and identify topics and opportunities for cooperation with German partners.', 'title': 'Component Leader ""forest planning and control"" of the DIAF project', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 424491, 'name': 'Forest Stewardship Council International (Bonn)', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQEsfkyqasfIlQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1664868591684?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=BnchcM_Y_TJTKOfVnL3avLyi51IO0Pnab58pe4cYGjY', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/fsc-international-bonn/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Congo Basin', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'Forest Stewardship Council', 'description': 'Assessment of the short and long-term economic, social and environmental impacts - positive and negative - of the implementation of Intact Forest Landscape (IFL) related management and protection measures in the Congo Basin.

France (COC - Mar 2014)
FSC®/PEFC Forest Management audits in Portugal for SATIVA, Controlo e Certificação (Jan & May 2018)', 'title': 'FSC® Forest Management Auditor (freelance)', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 619205, 'name': 'FCG Finnish Consulting Group', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4D0BAQFym4SJXX-0LQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1666850842326?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=yb9nHZCZ1FSMBWIhJ5ls2SKdUSSQhyxeX0U23MfQnPM', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/fcg-finnish-consulting-group-oy/', 'employees': {'start': 501, 'end': 1000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Guyana', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'FCG Finnish Consulting Group', 'description': 'Design and Implement REDD+ Pilot Activities for Guyana
The objective of the assignment is to prioritize, design and implement three (3) REDD+ pilot projects in consultation with stakeholders, consistent with the REDD+ Strategy and SESA for Guyana. Based on project ideas received from stakeholder consultations, we will draft 12 project profiles for discussion and  participatory  pre-screening  with  stakeholders,  in  areas  of  the  four  principal  drivers  of deforestation and forest degradation, namely: 1) the targeted harvesting of a limited number of prime commercial species, with little emphasis being placed by the loggers on efficiencies; 2) the clearing of forested areas for mining; 3) the conversion of forested areas to allow for agricultural activities; and 4) infrastructure development,such as roads.
In  a  consultative  process, we will prepare selection criteria for project prioritization taking into  consideration:  1) Emission  reduction  potential;2) Provision  of  ecosystem  services;3) Scalability and replicability; 4) Social benefits;and 5) Multiple co-benefits.
After the project ideas have been ranked and mutually agreed on, three (3) full projects will be designed in collaboration with local partners and implemented based on the documentation prepared and agreed on.', 'title': 'Environmental / Natural Resources Management Specialist', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 163765, 'name': 'FAO', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQGkEw1cImNSTQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1539165866324?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=ybNUe1PH5-8lftGdCyp169yRTYUqpWpGGU1r79VXzBk', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/fao/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Rome Area, Italy', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'FAO', 'description': 'Guyana has been negotiating a Voluntary Partnership Agreement (VPA) with the European Union since 2012 and concluded the process, which has involved extensive consultation with a wide range of stakeholders in-country and participatory preparation of all accompanying documentation, early 2019. 

Detailed procedures for defining and verifying legality, and issuing FLEGT licenses are presented as Annexes to the VPA agreement document 

October 2017: Assess the comprehensiveness, reasonableness, practicality and feasibility of the Guyana TLAS and recommend necessary adjustments based on the capacities, needs and realities on the ground. Provide advice on possible simplification and reduction of the texts.

12-29 December 2017: Evaluation of 4 Full Project Proposals as part of the Expert Panel for the FAO FLEGT Programme (Guyana)

12-19 October 2018 : Evaluation of 5 Project Proposals as part of the Expert Panel for the FAO FLEGT Programme (Guyana)

1-8 November 2019: Evaluation of 6 Project Proposals FAO EU-FLEGT Programme (Guyana)', 'title': 'Consultant for Guyana EU FLEGT VPA Annex Review', 'employment_type': 'Freelance'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Enabling Environments Ltd Mauritius', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Belize', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Enabling Environments Ltd Mauritius', 'description': 'Review and update the Belize Forests Act and its Subsidiary Laws to promote long-term conservation, management and sustainable use of the Forest Resources of Belize', 'title': 'Forest/Natural Resource Management Expert', 'employment_type': None}]}]",[],"['Forest Management', 'Forestry', 'Sustainability', 'Capacity Building', 'Sustainable Development', 'Proposal Writing', 'Natural Resource Management', 'Research', 'Environmental Impact Assessment', 'International Development', 'Environmental Management', 'Excel', 'Statistics', 'Environmental Management Systems', 'Climate Change', 'Ecology', 'Policy', 'Biodiversity', 'Carbon', 'Natural Resources']",,,
